titleStmt.title: True and happy news from Ireland, being the coppy of a letter vvritten from Sir W. Saintliger lord president of Munster, to the lord lieutenant of Ireland. Relating severall vallorous defeats given to the rebels, wherein many of them were slaine, the rest put to flight and much pillage taken. Read in the honorable House of Commons on Tuseday Aprill 25. 1642. Martis 25. Aprill. 1642. It is this day ordered by the Commons now assembled in Parliament, that this letter bee forthwith published in print. H. Elsinge Cler. parl. Com.
titleStmt.author: Saintliger, W., Sir (William), d. 1642.
Leicester, Robert Sidney, Earl of, 1595-1677.
England and Wales. Parliament.

notesStmt.note: A report to the Earl of Leicester.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
